title: Figma
summary: Figma is our core design tool, where youâ€™ll find everything needed to create consistent and user-friendly experiences. Components, variables, and typography styles to icons and more â€” itâ€™s all in one place, ready to support your design work.

columns.content: To access Figma, you need a Figma account with an SEB email address. If you need help with accessing SEB:s Figma libraries, please contact [figmasupport@seb.se](mailto:figmasupport@seb.se).

sections.title: Figma libraries
sections.section-content: A library in Figma is a collection of design assets, like components, styles, and variables. These design assets live in a single file, but can be reused across different files or projects.

columns.title: SEB Figma libraries
columns.content:
You will need to add some libraries to your design files when designing an SEB experience. Go to assets, choose "Recommended", there you find the following libraries:

â€“ Green for web ðŸ’š

[Read more about libraries on Figma](https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360041051154-Guide-to-libraries-in-Figma)
